title.narrative: OUTPUT 6.2: PROVISION OF QUALITY BASIC EDUCATION

description.narrative: Output 2: Capicity of MOET is enhanced to coordinate, plan, implement, and monitor provision of quality basic education with special attention for children with disabilities, which contributes to Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 6: Enhanced access to quality IECCD services, enrolment and learning outcomes especially for the most vulnerable primary school going age and over-aged children

related-activity.ref: 2520/A0/04/802 OUTCOME 6: ACCESS TO IECCD PRIMARY & NFE

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2: Capicity of MOET is enhanced to coordinate, plan, implement, and monitor provision of quality basic education withspecial attention for children with disabilities

description.narrative: UNICEF continues to strengthen the capacity of the MOET on the improvement of the Education Management Information System (EMIS), including the planned implementation of OpenEMIS. A total of 1,411 teachers were trained on child centred learning in this period exceeding the target. The inclusive education policy was approved by cabinet. | Status:Met | As-of Date:11/12/2018

title.narrative: System Strengthening - EMIS - Availability of an Education Management Information System that transparently feeds findings back to communities or school management committees - score (1-4), see guidance
Service Delivery - Teachers - Primary teachers who received training with funding provided by UNICEF
